img.alt: This Read residence kitchen was designed by Thayer Hopkins with JR Woodworks cabinets, quartzite counters, volcanic stone floors, and many trim details custom made by us of course!
This handrail was designed and built by Charlie for the Kornblum residence.
This two story deck was built in 2004 for the Tabatsky residence in conjunction with a 500 sq ft interior remodel and retrofit.
This kitchen was designed by Charlie and Gary Craddick at Kitchen Sync. These are Kraftmade Cabinets, Ceasarstone counters with recycled glass backsplash.

This kitchen for the Sharkey/Goldstein residence was designed by Kimberley Rosenberg and architect Ned White. Three rooms into one Great Room! This structural beam is 27 ft long and covered with birch.
This masterbath tub and shower area with heated floors, Waterworks fixtures, and crackled subway set tile in the shower.
The frame of any new room must be built to last in the Bay Area. We can only be proud of the final product as long as what is underneath it will stand the test of time.
This treehouse was designed and built on a steep downgrade behind the Elkins residence in Piedmont.
This is former employee and now General Contractor Adam Sgrenci making sure this wall is plumb.
This hidden door keeps this dining room spacious at the Carrington/Morson residence.
This bunk bed was designed by one of our favorite cabinet subcontractors, Jason Gooch of AppleBox. Installed by us for the Read residence.
